title: Comment on Dawson Kept it Simple, Fed Dorian Baker Down the Stretch by JokesOnMe(aka Ha!)
text:
Posted in Football , Main | 23 Responses UK Athletics 
The offense laid another egg last night. Noah Spence and Co. dominated the offensive line, the running game was non-existent (55 yards), and Patrick Towles was making mental mistakes aplenty in the first half. Down 14 with 4:59 to go , the Cats finally found a spark. 
â€œWhen you get in those ruts, the only way to get out of them is do simple stuff,â€ Shannon Dawson said after the game. They had to keep it simple because there wasnâ€™t a play that worked in the first half. â€œI donâ€™t think we executed anything for three quarters, to be honest with you,â€ Dawson said. â€œThere wasnâ€™t a call on my sheet that was good. There just wasnâ€™t.â€ 
â€œI donâ€™t know if thereâ€™s anything I can point to directly, but I feel like everybody as a unit, collectively, we came out sluggish. It wasnâ€™t just one man, two man, it was all of us, â€œDorian Baker said. 
Towles, Baker and the rest of the offense still remained optimistic, and finally began executing. They got it out of Patrickâ€™s hands quickly and began putting routine plays together. 
â€œThere was never any point tonight where I thought we were gonna lose the game. I honestly believe that. There were probably 20,000 other people who did, (but) that wasnâ€™t me. Thatâ€™s not our team,â€ Towles said. 
Towles and Dawson knew who they needed to get it to â€“ Dorian Baker. â€œI like the matchup with him with everything,â€ Dawson said. â€œWe were trying to do that the whole game a lot of times and the ball just wasnâ€™t finding him.â€ Dorian asked for the ball, and he received. 
On the final score, it wasnâ€™t originally supposed to be a fade to Baker . They had three receivers on the left side that were going to be primary targets, but Patrick told Dawson and Dorian on the sideline, â€œIf he has 1-on-1, Iâ€™m going to him.â€ Dorian and Pat both made the right read, linking up on the perfectly executed play. 
â€œHe(the defender) actually made a good play on the ball, but I just had to go up over top of him and take it away from him.â€ Dorian said there wasnâ€™t a chance he was going to let the defender beat him, â€œThereâ€™s no chance. I gotta make that play. 4th and 3. If I donâ€™t, we lose.â€ 
This sequence illustrates just how close it was to going the other. Luckily, Dorian doesnâ€™t lose often.
